description.en: The first part of the course focuses on the long-run macroeconomic phenomena like long-run income levels and economic growth in the context of Solow model and its extensions, and explores also the role of decisions made by households' and firms at microeconomic level. The second part of the course deals with short-run macroeconomics, seeking for the explanations and determinants of business cycles (like wage and price rigidity). The third part of the course introduces selected building blocks of the macroeconomic model (consumption and investment, unemployment and inflation) in order to form the basis for analysing the essence and effects of monetary and fiscal policies.
description.et: Kursuse esimeses osas selgitatakse majanduskasvu tegureid pikal perioodil Solow' mudeli ja selle edasiarenduste kontekstis, samuti majapidamiste ja ettevõtete käitumise seaduspärasusi ja rolli makromajandusliku tasakaalu ning heaolu kujunemisel. Kursuse teine osa käsitleb lühiperioodi makroökonoomikat ning keskendub äritsüklite olemuse ning põhjuste selgitamisele. Kursuse kolmandas osas käsitletakse makromajandusliku mudeli üksikuid plokke (tarbimine ja investeeringud, tööpuudus ja inflatsioon), mis loovad baasi raha- ja eelarvepoliitika olemuse ning mõjude analüüsiks.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to introduce theories which explain the factors behind the long-term economic growth and the short-term business fluctuations, and on this basis to analyse the possible effects of monetary and fiscal policies.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on tutvustada teooriaid, mis aitavad selgitada pikaajalist majanduskasvu ja majandusliku aktiivsuse lühiajalisi tsüklilisi kõikumisi mõjutavaid tegureid, ning nende baasil analüüsida rahapoliitika ja eelarvepoliitika rakendamise võimalusi.

description.et: There will be 3 homeworks that give 40% of the total grade. The instructors reserve the right to re-calibrate the score based on the best actual results in the group, but that cannot be assumed beforehand. The deadlines will be given (in most cases) at start of a tutorial, you have to follow the deadlines exactly. We prefer to have the solutions on paper (handwriting is OK), please try to avoid e-mailing them if you can. We only briefly comment the solutions on the paper (often not at all). Tutorials are time for solutions, complaints, questions, and related discussion. Each problem set contains a few exercises. We will evaluate mostly your work on the problem: if you try hard (and show it on the handed-in assignment), you will pass, even if you do not get the correct results.
The final exam will give 60% of the total grade.

grade_preconditions.et: In order to be allowed to take the final exam, the students should have submitted all 3 written assignments and have received at least 20% of the total points for these.

grade_evaluation.et:
The final grade is made of three home assignments (40%), and the final exam (60%). 
The points will be converted to the grades as follows: 1) score 90-100: A; 2) 80-89: B:, 3) 70-79: C; 4) 60-69: D; 5) 50-59: E; 6) Less than 50% - F (failed).

Those who wish to improve their grade will have a chance to write additionally a short essay, ca 5-7 pages, on some given economic growth topic. To be allowed to do that assumes that student has met the requirement towards the submission of the written assignments, i.e. the essay cannot substitute the assignments that are not submitted. The exact rules for writing the essay will be submitted later after the deadline for the 3rd assignments. The maximum points for the essay are 10% of the total grade.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
